metadata.job_to_be_done: Create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and compliance.

extracted_sections.section_title: Create a PDF and send it for review
In an authoring application such as Adobe InDesign, choose File > Print. Select Adobe
1. Open the PDF in Acrobat. From the upper left, select All Tools > Organize pag

subsection_analysis.refined_text: The Edit panel includes options to modify the page, add content, redact a PDF, and convert various documents to PDF forms. You can use the options in the Edit panel to replace, edit, or add text to a PDF. You can correct typos, change fonts and typeface size, adjust alignment, add superscripts or subscripts, and resize text or paragraphs.

Export You can save your changes to an Adobe PDF or PDF Portfolio in the original PDF or in a copy of the PDF. You can also save individual PDFs to other file formats, including text, XML, HTML, and Microsoft Word.
Copy images Use the Select tool to copy and paste individual images from a PDF to the clipboard, another application, or a file.
2. Right-click the image and select copy. Once done, you can paste it to a new file or a clipboard.
Select Acrobat in the upper-left (macOS) or Menu in the upper-left (Windows), then select Preferences. Under Categories, Select General. Then select the Make Select tool select images before text.
